unittitle.value: <emph render="italic">Souvenir of Coney Island, Brighton and Manhattan beaches</emph> viewbook

p.value:
Identification of item, date (if known); 
                <emph render="italic">Souvenir of Coney Island, Brighton and Manhattan beaches</emph> viewbook, V1986.023, Box number, Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
Source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1986.

Home Life Publishing Company published viewbooks in the early 20th century. Their office was located at 150 Nassau Street in Manhattan. Viewbooks, also called souvenir albums or view albums, are books that contain commercially published groups of photographs depicting a place, activity, or event.

The 
                <emph render="italic">Souvenir of Coney Island, Brighton and Manhattan beaches</emph> viewbook was published by the Home Life Publishing Company in 1904. The viewbook consists of 30 pages of black-and-white images of Coney Island, Brighton Beach, and Manhattan Beach which are adjacent oceanfront neighborhoods located on the eastern portion of Brooklyn. Views of Dreamland, Luna Park, the boardwalk and beach at Coney Island, and Surf Avenue are included, among others. The original softcover of the viewbook has been recovered with a hardcover, library binding and the page size is 5 x 7.5. Digital versions of the images from the viewbook are available via the image database located in the library.
